intro: Solanum manoelii, commonly known as the Manoelii nightshade, is a species native to the island of Madagascar. It is a shrub characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly serrated edge. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into spherical, smooth berries. These berries are typically yellow when mature and contain several seeds. Solanum manoelii is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes.
